result.execSummary:
The defendant Kerry Antonio Taper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Straight time with credit for 61 days time served.

miscConds.notes:
*Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, costs, fees and assessments by the end of supervision period or any remaining balance shall be converted to civil judgment. Provide DNA sample-pay surcharge.
*Court ordered restitution set at zero.
*Make an earnest effort towards full time employment.

*Submit to agent letter of apology-to be forwarded to the victim.
*Participate in Anger Management.

*Obtain AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment.
*Absolute sobriety with random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kerry Antonio Taper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Attorney Colin P. McGinn in court, defendant Kerry Antonio Taper not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. BRANCH 47 FOR BRANCH 24. Defense waived Bail/Bond Hearing and requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court granted defense request. Case scheduled off master calendar. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Per Court, case rescheduled to 6/23/2015 at 8:30 am. Parties notified.

Defendant Kerry Antonio Taper in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a bail/bond hearing.  This court will not be in session next week.  Judge Siefert's clerk has agreed to allow this matter to be set on Branch 47's calendar.  Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 47 for Branch 24.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Jeannie W. and her residence

Defendant Kerry Antonio Taper in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Kerry Antonio Taper in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
